name: Dixon Owen
reviewTxt: It's good. A bit long winded at times, but, as a book primarily focused on lexical scoping, it doesn't wander too much.

name: Morse Lloyd
reviewTxt: Before this, You Don't Know JS, series of books, there were no books that I'm aware of entirely focused on more advanced JavaScript.

name: Harriet Nicholson
reviewTxt: Not only does the author know what he's talking about, he knows how to communicate it.

name: Marisa Myers
reviewTxt: I have heard it said that a JS developer's knowledge of scope practically determines their experience level.

name: Lorie Best
reviewTxt: Awesome book. This book is targeted toward an experienced JS developer and is an excellent deep dive into the specific subject of JavaScript Scope and Closures.

name: Harper Hamilton
reviewTxt: This is a great start to the You Don't Know JS series. This book covers two topics that I constantly see JavaScript developers having an issue with.

name: Charles Cook
reviewTxt: Excellent book. I have been working with Javascript for many years. But, could never really wrap my head around scope and closures.

name: Glover Stephens
reviewTxt: I can't recommend this book enough. Matter of fact I recommended it to my entire team at work. This is definitely not a novice level JavaScript book. This book is meant for more advanced readers.

name: Mendez Day
reviewTxt: I have been learning JS afterwork for a couple months now and I feel like after reading this book every time I write a block of code Iâ€™m looking at it more from the perspective of someone being able to tell what I was thinking and me being able to see the closure more clearly

name: Lauri Pacheco
reviewTxt: I've been programming in JS for around 3 years and there were concepts that I didn't know about about scopes in JS and the way the author explained each detail is easy to understand, if you are a examples person you'll love this book.

name: Weeks Baird
reviewTxt: This is an excellent book overall. I can use it to improve my understanding of JavaScript and thereby also improve own JavaScript code.

name: Stokes Solomon
reviewTxt: This helped get me through a coding immersion program that got me a job as a software engineer. Kyle explains things so well. Not necessarily a beginner's book. Get through the basics and then use this to dig deeper. Excellent read.
